channel.title: Recent Programming Jobs
channel.description: Recent Jobs posted to the Programming category on We Work Remotely

item.title: Refined Haystack: Lead Full Stack Developer
item.description:
Location: Chicago, IL
URL: http://www.refinedhaystack.com/

Are you passionate about coding great products?  Do you understand the phrase network effects and what it implies?  Does planning and implementing the architecture of a product put you in your happy place?  Do you love window shopping good design for your home?  Then continue reading!

Summary: Refined Haystack is changing the way that the interior design community interacts and supports each other.  Following the successful launch of our platform, we are seeking a team oriented leader to  take ownership of  all aspects of our technology stack as we perfect the Chicago specific marketplace and prepare for grander ambitions.  This position partners with the product manager and CEO to define, validate, design, implement and roll out the next generation of interior design community tools.  You are responsible for the backend architecture technology decisions and development, input into and development of the front end user experience and strategizing about future mobile products.   

About Refined Haystack:  We are a technology driven company enabling local interior design professionals, passionate homeowners, and boutique showrooms and stores to interact with each other in a transparent, public way resulting in time saved identifying the right solution to design projects.  Interior designers sign up to create albums of projects and promote local showrooms and stores.  Showrooms and stores sign up to create a local listing where they are found and promoted as a local resource.  Homeowners find local designers and stores for guidance on interior design projects.

Job Duties:
  • Near term (3 months): Take over development of new product enhancements, both front and back end
  • Medium term (3 - 9 months): Architect mobile product solution, augment internal dev team, define product development vision
  • Long term (9 - 24 months): Lead and manage the technology efforts for RH, including a growing team to support company growth

Candidate Skills:
  • Experience developing web based applications in a Ruby on Rails environment
  • Self-motivated individual who loves to work independently in a fast paced environment
  • A team player who believes in helping others, not ever saying “that’s not my job”
  • Interest or experience in mentoring junior developers
  • A passion for technology keeping up to date knowledge of web technology and tools, and can think of how it can be utilized in future projects
  • Someone who is very detailed oriented and cares about shipping a product that delivers real value to the customer

Compensation:
This is a full-time work at home position.  Total compensation will vary depending on the candidate’s technical experience, industry experience, and risk/reward tolerance.  As a start-up, there currently are no company sponsored health insurance benefits.

To apply: Please email the following to chris@refinedhaystack.com: 1.) Resume 2.) Cover letter explaining why this is the perfect job for you and 3.) Link to your LinkedIn profile

item.title: SurfWatch Labs: Junior Ruby on Rails Developer
item.description:
Location: Sterling, VA
URL: https://www.surfwatchlabs.com/

ABOUT SURFWATCH LABS - https://www.surfwatchlabs.com/

RISK INTELLIGENCE THAT DELIVERS CYBER IN SIGHT

SurfWatch Labs delivers cyber risk intelligence solutions that help organizations understand the potential for cyber-attacks, determine the impact to their business and proactively address threats head on.

SurfWatch Labs was formed in 2013 by former US Government intelligence analysts to go beyond the low-level threat intelligence approach that can drown organizations in data. By aggregating and automatically analyzing vast amounts of data from a wide range of structured and unstructured sources, SurfWatch enables organizations to zero in on their unique cyber risk profile and ensure the most effective risk management strategies are identified and implemented.

SurfWatch Labs is a well-funded startup with offices in Northern Virginia and telecommuters around the globe.

RESPONSIBILITIES
As a rails web developer at SurfWatch Labs, you will be responsible for contributing to all aspects of building and maintaining several key web software applications. Primarily, you will work on developing and maintaining our customer-facing, production web applications.

Duties will include:

  • end-to-end web application development (database, business logic, front-end) for new site features and new web apps
  • back-end system development (internal admin applications, feed subscriptions, etc.)
  • online advertising and web analytic tools
  • operational support

REQUIREMENTS
At minimum, you will have at least a few years of professional experience with the following technologies and software. These are the tools that we work with every day and that we expect you to hit the ground running with. The quantity of your experience is not nearly as important as the quality of it.

NOTE: Only those with at least one year of Ruby on Rails need apply
  • Ruby on Rails
  • Some RDBMS (e.g. MySQL)
  • HTML/CSS/Javascript (jQuery)
  • Git
  • Agile, Iterative Development
  • excellent interpersonal and communication skills
  • action and detail oriented
  • highly motivated to drive projects to completion
As your code will be deployed in a high-volume internet production environment, performance tuning and testing will be critical to success.

BONUS POINTS
Building a responsive, highly-available web software application for 10s of 1000s of users.

  • Amazon Web Services (EC2, S3, RDS)
  • Deployment Management
  • Issue Tracking (Jira)
  • NoSQL Databases (Mongo)
  • Social Media Integration (Facebook, Twitter, etc)
  • RESTful web service API development and documentation
  • Database Schema Design and Indexing
  • Data Warehousing
  • Startup Experience
*100% telecommuting available for most qualified candidates and those with proven communications skills and verifiable experience.

To apply: Send resume to jason.polancich@surfwatchlabs.com

item.title: Optimal Software s.r.o: Senior UI / Javascript Developer
item.description:
Location: Czech Republic
URL: http://www.broadbandspeedchecker.co.uk

Note! This work is remote but we will prefer candidates based in Europe due to the whole team being based there.

Optimal Software is a small company that develops and operates speed test sites around the world. Our tools are used by millions of users every month and trusted by companies, governments and organizations such as BBC, Which?, Guardian etc.

Successful candidate will have following responsibilities
- create and maintain UI for our websites and web applications
- work within 4 person full stack agile team
- be responsible for UI of sites and web apps that millions of users see
- be part of SCRUM daily stand-ups and weekly sprints
- be available for 24h on-call duty 4-5 days a month

We are looking for a senior javascript/UI developer with following experience:
- 5+ year experience in javascript, specifically jQuery, AMD loaders, Mustache template engine
- 3+ year experience in HTML5 development
- good experience with HTML and CSS2/3
- Selfmotivated individual that takes initiative and able to work with minimal oversight

Preferred experience:
- experience in optimizing web page performance and pushing browsers to the limits
- experience with SCRUM 

Benefits:
- 4 week holidays per year
- quarterly performance bonuses
- bi-yearly company trips to exciting locations for rafting, skiing etc.

To apply: Send your CV and cover letter to janusz@broadbandspeedchecker.co.uk

item.title: MotorLot: ++ Ruby on Rails Developer ++
item.description:
Location: Scottsdale, AZ
URL: http://motorlot.com

Who is MotorLot?

MotorLot is the engine that runs independent auto dealers across the country. All-in-one web based software that helps dealers sell more cars. We are expanding and think you’ll like working with us.

What you'll be working on

We’re looking for a Rails programmer who loves challenges and is a bit car crazy. You'll be working on a wide variety of projects like:

  • Adding an integration with an outside marketing partner using an API.
  • Adding functionality to dealer websites.
  • Building new marketing tools
  • Optimizing usage rates

Ideal Experience
2+ years experience building web applications using Ruby on Rails
Experience with Amazon services
Github
Strong knowledge of version control systems and application deployment
Experience with testing frameworks
Experience working with API and FTP data imports and exports
Self-motivated and self-managed
Proven capability of working remotely
Ability to work in a fast paced, deadline driven, dynamic environment

Bonus
Experience building B2B applications
Experience in scaling web applications
Experience with test- or behavior-driven development
Full stack experience
Startup or small company experience
Entrepreneurial tendencies, you don’t need direction…we want to set you free to do your best
Open source contributions

To apply: Email us at jobs@motorlot.com. Include information you think would be most useful for us in understanding your background and accomplishments. Links to GitHub, Twitter, resume, projects and website are useful.

item.title: Smoke Reports: Full Stack Developer for Cannabis Platform
item.description:
Location: San Francisco, CA
URL: https://www.smokereports.com

About Smoke Reports

We are the most advanced cannabis platform ever created. From genetic recommendation engines, to cannabis production companies, and where you can find the finished products: Smoke Reports is ushering in the next generation of the cannabis industry. We are a newly funded cannabis startup looking for engineering work on a big Laravel project. We're working with genetics data, geo data, social networking stuff, APIs, data vis, localization, retailers, cannabis, education, and more! 

About the Technology

We're running on a LAMP stack with the Laravel framework, caching, gulp.js for task running, backed by github for source code. For the front end, we're utilizing jQuery, Bootstrap, and SASS. We try to utilize the best Laravel has to offer with a codebase that has strong principles to increase flexibility and testability.

You should be very comfortable with:
  • PHP
  • Laravel (including all the good parts)
  • MySQL
  • jQuery / JavaScript
  • HTML / CSS
  • Github

Big plus if you've got experience or familiarity with:
  • Linux command line stuffs
  • Setting up and tearing down servers or services
  • Debugging running servers/services for performance or issues

About the Job

You'll work directly with the founder, who created the platform, in helping to modify, grow, and improve the existing codebase. You should be able to take ownership of projects from beginning to end. You should also be comfortable hopping into existing codebases to get up to speed. We're releasing new features constantly, and building cool stuff from prototype to implementation rapidly.

You will be expected to not only create awesome things the company needs, but contribute cool ideas about what we could do better, build better, or code better.

This is an exciting opportunity to get into an early position with a rapidly growing startup in San Francisco. This is a remote position with opportunities for contracted full-time, part-time, or freelance-style employment (we're flexible).

Thanks for reading and be excellent to each other!

This job is for an individual and not open to recruiters or contracting services.

To apply: Send a resume and applicable links to david@smokereports.com.

item.title: Robots + Rockets: Front End Engineer
item.description:
Location: Newport Beach, CA
URL: http://robotsandrockets.co

Angular.  HTML.  CSS.  PhoneGap.  Backend is generally Ruby/ Parse.  

Short and long term contract work.  How long term?   As long as you want.  How short?  Some contracts are as brief as 2-3 days.   

We are a 90% distributed company with a small HQ in Southern California.  

We are an app and service laboratory exploring consumer and B2B opportunities.  It's never boring.

To apply: Contact mark@robotsandrockets.co.

item.title: InQuicker: Full-Stack Ruby Developer
item.description:
Location: Nashville, TN
URL: http://inquicker.com

We are on a mission to break down the barriers and inefficiencies that separate people from the healthcare they need. Our market-leading online scheduling system is used to improve patient’s access to health care in hundreds of hospitals and other healthcare facilities around the United States.

We have an inclusive culture with competitive compensation, we focus on results and good work/life balance, and are dedicated to making a positive impact on how health care is accessed.

We are growing quickly and are looking for exceptional developers to join our development team. You should be an experienced, self-motivated, and opinionated developer with expertise in Ruby, Rails, and JavaScript. You should value testing, have a passion for your work, and a willingness to challenge decisions.

We might be looking for you, if:

  • You are a talented and experienced full-stack developer with expertise in Ruby and JavaScript.
  • You have passion for developing and maintaining stable and secure web applications.
  • You are comfortable participating in architectural decisions.
  • You enjoy collaborating with other developers to solve problems and refine ideas.
  • When you hear ‘automated tests’ it makes you happy, not sad.
  • You have desire to learn and grow, individually and as a team.
  • You have strong communication skills, online and in person.
  • People that know you would consider you direct, honest, and not afraid to speak your mind.
  • You want to work somewhere that lets you make a direct and positive impact on peoples lives.

To apply: If this sounds like you, send an email with your resume to jerrett@inquicker.com and let me know why you are the next developer we’re looking for and tell me what interests you about working with us at InQuicker.

item.title: HBI E-commerce: Senior Web Developer
item.description:
Location: Austin, TX
URL: http://www.losethebackpain.com

Awesome Opportunity for Experienced Web Developer

  • Tired of Corporate BS?
  • Is Your Current Job Lacking Excitement and Challenge?
  • Would You Like to be Rewarded and Recognized?
  • Want a True "Career" Instead of a Job?

Well, if you are highly talented, innovative and driven web developer, this might be last "job" you ever look at or consider! Seriously...

This opportunity is a very special one and here's why...

We are a fast-growing and results focused e-commerce company and we are looking for for a full-time web developer to join our team. We are very, very different from most companies and you'll discover this as you read through this job posting.

When you work here, you are truly part of a real team. Our #1 core value is "Family" and our team is like a combination of a healthy family and a professional sports team or elite military unit (think Navy Seals). 

This position reports to our CTO and can be here in our Austin, TX office or virtual / remote. To be considered for a virtual position you must be able to prove you’ve performed at a high level in that environment multiple times in the past.

Your primary responsibilities will include:

  • Maintain and develop additional capabilities of our ecommerce system, including integrating with various third party applications via their APIs.
  • Manage the performance and optimization of existing websites, including our primary website (www.losethebackpain.com), online ecommerce store, and various sales funnels.
  • Work closely with CTO to implement coding standards and project templates for all future projects. 
  • Work closely with project manager and marketing team to help execute their vision (ie. new sites, web applications, surveys, etc)
  • Design and build dynamic and mobile responsive landing pages, order forms, HTML emails, etc

In order to be considered, you MUST have demonstrable skill in the following areas:  

  • HTML (very experienced)
  • CSS (very experienced)
  • PHP (very experienced)
  • Javascript (very experienced)
  • SQL syntax and querying a database (very experienced)
  • Responsive principles (will need to demonstrate grasp of concept and show examples)
  • UX optimization 
  • Ability to work with .psd files provided by designer to produce working web sites.
  • Site tuning and performance optimization (HTTP Profiling, PageSpeed, etc.)
  • CMS experience (ie. Wordpress, Drupal, etc)
  • Ecommerce experience

Bonus if you have experience in: 

  • Strong design and creative skills
  • Direct response online marketing
  • Understanding of what an "online sales funnel" is
  • Marketing automation systems such as InfusionSoft, SilverPop, Bronto, etc...
  • JQuery
  • HTML5
  • node.js

The following should also be true about you:  

  • You have a strong portfolio and breadth of experience, especially in ecommerce
  • You have the ability to wireframe concepts quickly
  • You can work with design tools such as Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator
  • You understand SEO and how to build sites that support a strong SEO focus
  • While not a designer, you know good design when you see it and can help suggest improvements

Do you have these personality traits?

  • Highly driven – Passionate, self-starter who thrives under pressure
  • High energy - We work hard and play hard
  • Responsible - Truly have an ownership attitude
  • Productive - Great at managing your time and getting shit done
  • Organized - Manage multiple projects on time and on budget
  • Detail oriented - Must have an eye for detail
  • Analytical - Identify trends, patterns, problems and create solutions
  • Innovative - Come up with new ideas, better solutions
  • Resourceful - Finds ways over, around or through barriers
  • Team Player – Approachable, good collaborator
  • Fun - Good sense of humor as we LOVE to crack jokes and have fun
  • Great communicator - strong written and verbal communication

Yes, what we are looking for is very rare and hard to find... if you think you've got it all, we definitely want to hear from you!


ABOUT US

The Healthy Back Institute is a health publishing and consumer products business focused on helping people to live without back pain. Founded in 2003, it has quickly become one of the web's leading resources for people looking for information and products to help them find relief.

7 Reasons Why You'd Likely LOVE Working With Us

#1 Stability
We've been in business since 2003 and have gone through many of the "rough patches" already. We are now a very strong and healthy company and aren't going anywhere for a very long time. We are profitable, debt free and completely privately owned. In 2011 we were awarded a spot in the Inc 500/5000 coming in at #595 and we have just hit another period of fast growth.

#2. Opportunity
Unlike most companies that want to keep your pay as low as they can, we do the opposite! Our goal is to pay you as much as we possibly can because when we do, we know that means you are creating tremendous value for our customers and our business.

#3. Flexibility
Location doesn't matter to us. I don't care if you're working on the beach, your kitchen, or in your backyard. I don't care if you work from 6 a.m. - 2 p.m. Or from noon – 8 p.m… As long as you stay productive and produce results – that's all that matters. Note that some positions do require working in our Austin, TX office.

#4. Freedom
We believe that all people deserve to be free... free to make their own choices... free to create their own success... and we strive to create a work environment that not only allows, but empowers you to be creative and take risks (well thought out of course). No company politics or popularity contests. We are a team of "producers"... people who are results oriented and believe that each person should be responsible for themselves.

#5. Great People
You'd be joining an existing team of superstars, many of which have been with the company for years. There is virtually no “drama” within the team that most companies have. Everybody is fun, passionate, great at what they do, and willing to help out. If you're that kind of person – you'll fit in perfect.

#6. Training and Education
We invest heavily in our knowledge and skills. As part of our team you'll have access to an enormous library of "how to" and "self improvement" books and courses and we also reimburse our team when they invest in continued education. Many companies SAY they're going to do this, but then force you to go to seminars and workshops you don't want to go to. When you work for us – YOU get to choose the format in which you'd like to continue your education.

#7. Growth
We are growing at warp speed and have continued to increase profits year after year. This growth also means growth for you... in knowledge, skills, relationships and income.

To apply: Apply online here: http://healthybackinstitute.theresumator.com/apply/fA2Hn3/Web-Developer.html?source=37SG

item.title: SiteDocs: Creative Full Stack Developer
item.description:
Location: Abbotsford, BC
URL: http://www.sitedocs.com

Make a big impact in our small development team. We're a startup that has recently found product-market fit, and are finally at a point where we can recoup some technical debt. In our case, that means building a shiny new version of the product. If you're excited about making things people want and moving quickly on a new project with clear requirements and a great team, we want to talk to you.

The application is built with C# all over (using .Net on the server and Xamarin on the mobile clients) but we don't care what language and stack you're used to--in fact, we'd probably prefer it if you're not married to a single stack, .Net or otherwise. Our company is based near Vancouver (in BC, Canada) and if you happen to live nearby you'd be welcome to work at the office, but many of us work remotely.

Since we're a small team, there's a lot of overlap with what everyone's working on and you'll often get to choose which tasks you prefer. Some of the things that we'll be doing in the next little while include:
  • Building mobile/tablet UIs for iOS and Android using Xamarin
  • Building a data access layer for a third-party sync service (to be re-used on server and client)
  • Updating our web admin interface to use the new DAL

Skills & Requirements
We're interested in applicants across the spectrum of experience. There's lots of work to be done, and we can probably find some that's a good match for your skill set. More generally, we want you to be:
  • Self-motivated!
  • Really interested in programming. All of the best programmers we know have little side projects that they do in their own time, because programming is a super-power and it's fun.
  • Creative. Not necessarily in an "artsy" sense but we want you to enjoy building things.
  • Able to work well in a team.
  • Able to communicate well, especially in written form.

About SiteDocs
SiteDocs is a start-up based in the lower mainland of British Columbia, Canada. We make software that helps companies manage their safety programs. Workplace safety is a giant, growing industry and paper-based safety programs are a giant pain. We replace stacks of binders (literally) in work trucks with an app on a tablet, and a "magic" way for forms to get signed in the field and recorded in the office without spending any time as a sheet of crumpled paper. It's a pretty simple concept with huge demand, so execution is important. We think we've managed to do a pretty good job so far; our current customers love the product and we still have excellent potential for growth. 

To apply: Please email dave.noel@sitedocs.com to tell us why you'd be a good fit!

item.title: Shipt: Senior Rails Developer
item.description:
Location: Birmingham, AL
URL: https://www.shipt.com

Shipt is a well-funded startup tackling the same day delivery space.  We've launched our initial product and need you to help us build out the platform.  You are:

  1. Highly proficient with Rails (hey DHH!)
  2. Uncomfortable using anything but git for source control
  3. Comfortable writing tests
  4. HTML/CSS/JS
  5. Above all, you enjoy learning (and are good at it!)

It would also be nice if:

  1. You've used AWS
  2. You understand devops
  3. Can navigate a linux server

This is a full time position as an employee of Shipt.  You'll get health benefits, PTO, holidays and a great salary.  You will also get the opportunity to learn and grow your skills (we have a lot of challenging problems to solve)!

If you can help us understand that you are a truly great developer, we look forward to hiring you.

To apply: Send a resume to harris@shipt.com

item.title: Kaleo Software: Senior Software Engineer
item.description:
Location: Los Angeles, CA
URL: http://www.kaleosoftware.com/

Hi there! We (Kaleo) are looking for a Senior Software Engineer.

Guess What? That developer could be you!

If you’ve ever wanted to work for a high-performance startup that’s building next-generation software for large enterprises, this could be your dream job!

We Want People That
Want to build software that enhances the productivity of peoples’ day-to-day lives while empowering a company to become more competitive. If you have solid work ethic, a strong level of curiosity and the need for speed then we want to hear from you. You’re an experienced Ruby/Rails developer, comfortable with the web stack.

Expert Level:
  • Ruby/Rails 4+
  • Elasticsearch
  • PostgreSQL

Competent:
  • HTML/Haml/JavaScript/jQuery

Want to Learn or Develop Your Skills In:
  • JRuby (Torquebox/vert.x/Jubilee)
  • ReactJS
  • CoffeeScript
  • ClojureScript

A Day in the Life
So, what exactly would you be doing were you to join our small, mighty and growing team? Well, even though we are building “Enterprise Software”, you can kiss those TPS reports goodbye. We follow the Goldilocks development methodology: “Just enough” process to make sure we are working well as a team.

One day you might be hacking out some proof-of-concept for a new feature, and getting real-world feedback on usability, or performance.

Another day you might not write code at all but instead spend time thinking deeply about a complicated problem, and designing potential solutions.

Most days, you will be writing new, production-quality code (and tests) that implement innovative new features to our product set.

Every day, you should feel challenged and empowered to do the best work of your life.

What Does Kaleo Do?
Imagine a working environment where you’re never lost. It’s a world where the answers to your questions are at your fingertips and you don’t spend hours digging through outdated wikis and company intranets. Here at Kaleo we are building next-generation software to facilitate rapid business process improvement by empowering employees and executive management of some of the largest companies in the world.

Ok, But Will I Actually Like Working at Kaleo?
We think so. If you like tackling difficult problems and working with smart people, you’ll feel right at home here. On top of that, we work hard to make sure the company culture is strong and welcoming, and that the work arrangements are flexible enough to work for you.

Things We All Enjoy at Kaleo!
  • Competitive Compensation and Equity: We value our team members and will offer you meaningful compensation for your contributions.
  • Great health, dental, & vision insurance: We care about your pearly whites.
  • Unlimited PTO: We trust you to get things done and take the time you need to recharge.
  • Flexible working arrangements: Partial or full-time remote opportunities available for the right candidate.
  • New hardware to get the job done.
  • Daily meditation breaks: Come get your ‘zen’ on with us.
  • Fun and entertainment: Beer O’Clock Fridays and quarterly company outings to Las Vegas and San Diego, plus we have a stocked kitchen with tons of healthy snacks.
  • Location: We’re just a few miles from Manhattan Beach. Surf’s up!

Compensation
Cash comp paired with equity —we are looking for the best and will pay them accordingly. Health coverage, dental, and vision benefits. The opportunity for growth in a fast-paced progressive company is yours for the taking.

Learn more @: http://bit.ly/kaleo-job-eng

To apply: Please send a resume to jobs@kaleosoftware.com with the job title in the subject line.

item.title: DataStax: Cassandra Internals Engineer
item.description:
Location: Santa Clara, Ca
URL: www.datastax.com

Cassandra Internals Engineer
Apache Cassandra is the world's leading distributed database.  A Cassandra cluster can scale linearly from a handful to hundreds of machines across multiple datacenters, without compromising per-node performance.

DataStax is looking for an engineer to help take Cassandra to the next level.  At DataStax you will work closely with Apache Cassandra project chair Jonathan Ellis and many committers both at DataStax and in the broader community from all over the world.

DataStax is a place where you can make a meaningful difference as an individual contributor in a quickly-growing team.  Our executives meet regularly with the entire company to discuss strategy, successes, and challenges.  New features and products can and have evolved out of a "weekend hack."  There is no bureaucracy for the sake of bureaucracy.

Job Summary
  • Work with the community to design, implement and review features for Apache Cassandra, with a focus on those conferring performance advantages
  • Troubleshoot bug reports from internal QA, from customers, and the Apache community
  • Eventually achieve committer status on Apache Cassandra
  • Explain the Cassandra family of technologies to the world through blog postsand conference presentations
Job Requirements
  • Strong Java background in systems or back-end software
  • Experience designing multi-threaded systems and algorithms
  • Knowledge of common data structures, algorithms and architectures, and the ability to apply this knowledge practically
  • Good written communication skills: comfortable with a distributed team interacting primarily over email, IRC, and our bug tracker
  • Comfortable reading, reviewing, and modifying others' code
  • Strong troubleshooting skills
Nice to have
  • Experience with scalable systems design and implementation
  • Comfortable reasoning about algorithmic complexity
  • Comfortable researching specialised data structures and algorithms
  • Involvement in an open-source community
  • BS degree in Computer Science or equivilant

To apply: Apply Here: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?aj=o18RZfwJ&s=weworkremotely

item.title: DataStax: Software Engineer (Tools)
item.description:
Location: Santa Clara, Ca
URL: www.datastax.com

DataStax, the leading distributed database management system that brings Apache Cassandra to the enterprise, is looking for a talented Engineer to work on our developer tools, a toolset developers use to interact with Cassandra and DataStax Enterprise clusters. This position will be located anywhere in the US.
Essential Job Functions

The cool stuff you’ll do

·         Create and update high productivity tools that developers working with Cassandra will use daily

·         Troubleshoot bug reports from internal QA, from customers, and from the Apache community

·         Help developers become more familiar with our tools through blog posts or discussions at community events

Job Requirements

The stuff you’ll need to succeed

·         Strong Java background in systems or back-end software

·         Familiar with popular tools and frameworks used in the enterprise Java space

·         Comfortable working with a team either locally or distributed

·         BS degree in Computer Science

·         Candidates can be located anywhere

The stuff that would be nice to have (but not a deal breaker)

·         Familiarity with other languages such as Python or Ruby

·         Experience designing multi-threaded systems

·         Experience with Apache Cassandra or Hadoop

·         Experience with git source control

To apply: Apply Here: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?cj=owSBZfwI&s=weworkremotely

item.title: DataStax: Software Architect (DSE Team)
item.description:
Location: Santa Clara, Ca
URL: www.datastax.com

DataStax is looking for a talented software architect with expertise building high-performance, distributed systems to join our team in creating a distributed, scalable NoSQL data management platform. DataStax Enterprise Server, based on Apache Cassandra, allows you to easily run analytics and search on your real time data.


Primary responsibilities include:
  • Responsible for the high level design of entire products, working with multiple development teams and other architects
  • Create software design specs from high level requirements
  • Be an evangelist for the product both internally and externally
  • Build prototypes, frameworks, and modules
  • Help support with escalations as needed
QualificationsThe stuff you'll need to succeed:
  • CS Degree plus 7+ years experience
  • Thrives in startup company culture
  • Experience building and designing Java backend servers for enterprise software
  • Cassandra, Spark, Hadoop, Solr or similar experience
  • Experience with distributed systems or databases
  • Able and willing to write tech articles and/or blog posts
  • Experience in an environment where the software was the product
  • An understanding of security (LDAP, Kerberos, Encryption, etc..) is highly desirable
  • NoSQL/BigData experience preferred but good relational background will be considered
The stuff we are looking for in a team mate:
  • A strong personality is needed in this role but must be able to work with the rest of the team and mentor other developers.  You are seen as an expert and a teacher
  • Easy to work with but has high expectations of self and others
  • Competitive streak: wants the win personally and be part of the companies win
  • Customer fanatic: willing to jump in and do anything to help customers

To apply: APPLY HERE: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?aj=oSBxZfwJ&s=weworkremotely

item.title: Clevertech: Incredible node.js Leader
item.description:
Location: New York, NY
URL: www.clevertech.biz

About You

Web Development is your biggest passion (even if you tell your significant other a different story).

Even though you’re most comfortable with node.js, you love trying out new languages, frameworks, libraries, and leveraging them off, whenever necessary.

You have rejected offers from companies like Google, Facebook, or Twitter, because they don’t believe in the power of Remote Teams.

You have led projects and teams to success.

You have visible and amazing accomplishments.

About Clevertech

We have been around for 14 years and have over 70 developers and designers, scattered all over the world working together.

We are very much enthralled by Agile and Lean principles, successfully launching products in short windows of time. That’s possible due to the power of focus.

Some of the great things we do are visible in http://cleverstack.io, http://cleverte.ch/bloomberg, http://visualcaptcha.net, and http://clevertech.biz.

We could tell you more, but it’s much more interesting to see what you find out.

About the Job

If you fit this description, reach out with your 2-3 best accomplishments and tell us a story about your ambition and how working with us will help you achieve it.

We only require that you work at least 5 hours within New York’s 9am-5pm.

This is a full-time, fully remote, 8h/day, 40h/week, 160h/month offer.

Note for US residents: this is corp-2-corp (1099, not W2).

To apply: http://hire.clevertech.biz/job/53d11b3ef74076752edb3956

item.title: Golden Frog: Sr. JavaScript Engineer
item.description:
Location: Austin, Tx
URL: www.goldenfrog.com

"While we're headquartered in Austin, Tx,  some of our team is remote.  We care more about what you can do than where you live"

Help us architect and implement cutting edge web application and websites for Golden Frog and our sister companies. You will work closely with our web designers and system engineers to implement user interfaces and consumer facing web applications.

Primary Responsibilities:

  • Lead the development of new features and defect resolution on existing applications, as well as assist with scoping and designing new product initiatives
  • Participate in an active Agile team environment - provide estimates, participating in retrospectives, give product demos, participate in daily stand-ups reports, etc. 
  • Task and estimate product feature requests
  • Establish and implement best practices and standards
  • Lead research and design efforts when considering new frameworks, libraries and technologies
  • Maintain and improve quality standards to deliver high quality feature releases
  • Mentoring team members and knowledge sharing across the organization
 
Skills & Requirements:

  • 5+ years’ experience with web-based development
  • Proficiency with “vanilla” JavaScript; experience with JavaScript libraries (e.g., jQuery, Prototype, YUI, etc.)
  • Experience with 2 or more JavaScript frameworks (e.g., Ember, AngularJS, Backbone, etc.)
  • Experience developing large-scale applications using 1 or more of the following methodologies: MVVM, MVC, MVP
  • Experience with HTML and CSS
  • Self-motivated and driven individual that takes initiative and able to work with minimal supervision

Preferred Skills:

  • Experience with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Kanban, Lean, etc.)
  • Unit testing experience

Golden Frog provides the opportunity to work on the latest operating systems with fast moving and technically challenging projects.  You can see some of our products here:   

http://www.goldenfrog.com/vyprvpn
http://www.goldenfrog.com/dumptruck
http://www.goldenfrog.com/cyphr

Technically talented teams.   A variety of challenging projects. Standard business hours that allow for an enjoyable work/life balance. And, the ability to contribute! This is what you can look forward to if you join our team. This position also offers a generous 401k profit-sharing plan, medical, dental, and vision insurance, and paid time off (including the week between Christmas and New Year’s!).

To apply: https://hire.jobvite.com/j?aj=oHnPZfwC&s=WeWorkRemotely

item.title: Tealeaf Academy: Senior Ruby and Javascript Developer
item.description:
Location: N/A
URL: http://www.gotealeaf.com

We are looking for someone to help us build Ruby/Rails and Javascript training courses. Work includes scoping and building course projects, organizing topic and explaining concepts in writing. English fluency is a must. 

Looking for someone with strong Ruby and Javascript project experiences, can write well and explain concepts with clarity, and enjoy teaching and working with junior developers. Many people come to us to become professional developers and pursue their passion. Your work will literally change the trajectories of their lives. 

Need at least 15~20 hours per week commitment.  You will have a lot of creative freedom and autonomy - we like to work with capable people so we don't have to manage.  Will pay competitively and happy to work long term with the right person. 

Check out our site at www.gotealeaf.com and email me at kevin@gotealeaf.com if interested, with a few paragraphs of your experience.

To apply: Please send some paragraphs of your background and past project experiences to kevin@gotealeaf.com.

item.title: Open mHealth: Software Engineer focused on front-end at non-profit digital health startup
item.description:
Location: NYC but love remote
URL: http://www.openmhealth.org

Open mHealth is a non-profit technology company that’s unlocking digital health data.

As Software Engineer, you’ll be focusing on front-end development. Your scope will be everything from writing code to collaborating around how to make the Open mHealth platform and products better and widely adopted. You’ll be taking digital health data from disparate places and making it meaningful for patients and clinicians. You’ll need to be able to zoom in on fine-grained details as well as zoom out on the product roadmap and work alongside our lead engineer, lead designer, product managers and data scientist.

Part of Open mHealth is our growing developer community. You’ll be continuously sharing your work with others, so documenting and sharing what you and your team are doing is critical for growing and nurturing the community.

Our open platform is built to encourage interoperability and adoption, so we use open-source technologies and follow best practices. We publish RESTful APIs that use OAuth for authorization and exchange JSON documents conforming to JSON Schemas. 

Our frontends are built in HTML, CSS, and JS using AngularJS, and leverage tools like Bower, Grunt, Karma, Jasmine, and Protractor. 

Our backends are built in Java and Spring, use MongoDB, PostgreSQL and other data stores. We build with Gradle, create Docker containers, host on AWS, and release often. We’re always interested in different technologies, and try to settle on what’s well understood and fit for purpose.

While Open mHealth is based in NYC and San Francisco, we’re looking to hire the best people, wherever you are in the world.
  • In-depth knowledge of HTTP and RESTful APIs
  • Advanced skills in front-end development, including AngularJS and data visualization.
  • Some skills in server-side web development (Java, node.js or any other JVM languages). We’ve built the open architecture using Java because of scalability reasons.
  • You have deep knowledge of: JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, AngularJS, D3/highcharts/chartjs, phonegap, responsive design, and Git
  • Would be awesome if you also knew: Gradle, Jasmine, Grunt, Gulp, Protractor and eager to learn iOS and Android development.
  • You’ve shipped software products to market before and have at least 3+ years professional software development experience
  • You’re a go-getter, a doer and passionate about building beautiful things. Not to mention you’re self-motivating, self-directing and always communicating.
  • You want to help us break down the barriers to health data and help change the face of healthcare as we know it
  • BS or MEng/S in computer science, software engineering, or equivalent experience
  • You can communicate effectively in both written and verbal form with engineers, funders, business executives, and healthcare professionals
  • Proven telecommuting skills: self-motivating, self-directing, and aggressively communicative (if working remotely)

Great benefits
  1. Health (Medical, Dental, Vision)
  2. Financial (403b) and Life Insurance
  3. Community Supported Agriculture Stipend
  4. Healthy activity stipend
  5. Flexible hours
  6. Work remotely
  7. We care about work-life balance

Open mHealth is an "at-will", equal opportunity employer that does not discriminate in employment matters because of race, religion, sex, national origin, ethnicity, age, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation, gender (including pregnancy and gender expression) identity, color, marital status, veteran status, medical condition, or any other classification protected by federal, state, or local law or ordinance.

To apply: Send along a resume, cover letter and pointers to any work you’re proud of. Email everything to jointheteam@openmhealth.org. Include “Software Engineer” in the subject line. Please send your resume as a PDF.

item.title: General Assembly: Full Stack Engineer
item.description:
Location: New York, NY
URL: ga.co

Who we are

General Assembly (https://generalassemb.ly/) is a venture-backed, NYC-based startup focusing on education for individuals and enterprises in the areas of technology, design, and entrepreneurship. We currently have physical classrooms in 11 cities across 4 continents, with tens of thousands of students coming through our doors.

Who you are

We are looking for talented & creative engineers to join our growing team, and help us build great products.

  • You have 3-5 years of experience as a mid to senior level engineer
  • You're used to working with Rails & Ruby and you have advanced experience building RESTful web services & APIs
  • You have experience working with a variety of languages, with a strong grasp of their pros & cons
  • You're a kind & respectful person, invested in contributing to a wonderful team culture (bullies & big egos stictly not allowed)
  • You are occasionally enthusiastic to the point of being profoundly uncool
  • You get insanely excited by at least 1 thing that has absolutely nothing to do with computers

Some other things that would be really nice to have ... 

  • Strong front-end development skills
  • Experience designing service-oriented architecture
  • Web operations or system administration experience

What we build

We are organized into small cross-functional product teams (a PM, a designer, a few devs) that focus on growing a single product from glimmer to gamechanger. Each team is free to determine their own tools & process. What are these teams working on?

  • Data & systems that support our global campus business - https://generalassemb.ly/locations
  • Evolving large applications into an ecosystem of microservices
  • Innovative online education experiences for consumer & enterprise users - https://generalassemb.ly/education/web-design-circuit
  • Platforms to connect our community of students & alumni - http://profiles.ga.co
  • Internal tools supporting every part of our organization 

What it's like to be on the team
  • We use GitHub for code review, Code Climate and Semaphore to keep entropy at bay, and Heroku to focus on building things
  • We favor trying new things over fear of mistakes
  • We are anti-dogmatic: use whatever code editor you like, pair-program when you like
  • We try to seek a balance between sticking with what works and fearlessly exploring the new
  • We are always learning, always teaching
  • We are passionate about writing good code
  • We apologize for and learn from our mistakes
  • We have worked hard to build a culture of trust, continual improvement, and mutual support

We <3 remotes!

Even though GA is headquartered in New York City, more than half of our engineering team is not. We remote in from little towns and big cities from California to the Netherlands. And even our New York devs spend the odd day (or month) working from home or elsewhere.

We are serious about making remote collaboration work, with tools like Slack, Skype, and Screenhero becoming a big part of our daily lives.

Four times a year, we fly the whole engineering team to New York for a few days of workshops, lightning talks, urban adventures, and an epic hackathon.

To apply: Apply online: http://grnh.se/0cnigt

item.title: Klixplus Pty Ltd: Senior Developer
item.description:
Location: Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia
URL: http://klixplus.com/

QLD - Gold Coast
Permanent Full-time
About Us

My name is Adam and 7 years ago I started a small but dynamic Web Development Company. Today we own and run high traffic web sites with over 500,000 visitors daily. We are based on the Gold Coast Queensland and are profitable and growing. If you're wanting to be a part of a young successful team and who love technology then read on....

Who would be the right fit for us?

We are a team of Ruby/Rails enthusiasts and most of our new projects are built around this technology, however you would need to have very strong linux server administration skills, understand PHP and other popular programming languages. Some things we use every day and love: Linux, Git, GitHub, Vim, nginx, Varnish, Unicorn, Rails, PostgreSQL, Redis, Javascript/CoffeeScript, and others. Proven experience with high-traffic web sites and TDD/BDD are pluses.

Personality wise we talk every day, but only for a few minutes here and there via Campfire, Email, or Skype. The ideal candidate would be able to get his ideas/points/communication across in as few words/phrases as possible, the same way their code should also be developed.

Other Important Things

We allow full time commuting. We have offices on the Gold Coast so visiting us should be fun. We allow our developers to contribute to open source. The developers here get to pick their tools and technologies on new projects, as well as name new code bases they start. We pay competitively.

To apply: Drop us a line and show us one of your projects, a GitHub/StackOverflow profile, or anything else you're proud of to: jobs@klixplus.com

item.title: Hack Reactor: Lead Mentor
item.description:
Location: San Francisco, CA
URL: http://www.hackreactor.com/

Hack Reactor is a school for software engineers.  Among graduates of our three-month program, the placement rate is 99% and the average salary is $105,000.  This year, we will educate more software engineers than Stanford, UC Berkeley, and Caltech combined.  Students frequently describe the program as "The best decision I ever made" in the yelp reviews listed here: http://yelp.com/biz/hack-reactor-san-francisco

The Lead Mentor works closely with a small classroom of students across the length of the program, and is charged with both with the students' educational outcomes as well as the strength of the classroom community.  They watch over a class of students in the midst of a career transition and ensure on a day-to-day basis that everyone is learning rapidly and is on track for success.  When a student gets a job after the program, the lead mentor is the person they thank with the deepest emotion.
This role is for Hack Reactor's Remote program.  The program mirrors Hack Reactor's onsite program in all imaginable ways (admissions, daily schedule and events, curriculum, daily pair programming, outcome goals) except that students work from home and connect with peers and staff using a variety of web tools.  Hack Reactor Remote is the world's first web-based immersion school, and in terms of educational efficacy, there is no comparably effective web-based program.

Duties:
  • Lecture Q&A
  • Office hours
  • Individual instruction and tutoring
  • Circulate among students
  • Review student progress across several indicators
  • Build and execute student action plans to ensure that nobody falls through the cracks

Qualifications:
  • Expert-level software engineer
  • Ability to model student progress and remove educational roadblocks
  • Empathy and charisma
  • Passion for education and service
  • Expert-level JavaScript knowledge strongly preferred

To apply: Apply here: https://www.smartrecruiters.com/HackReactor/79972472-lead-mentor-remote-

item.title: Taproot Foundation: DEVELOPER, TAPOOT+
item.description:
Location: San Francisco, CA
URL: http://www.taprootfoundation.org/

THE OPPORTUNITY

The Taproot Foundation built the pro bono movement, bringing critical skills to nonprofits and connecting high-powered professionals to rewarding service opportunities—but we couldn’t have done it without our best-in-breed tech tools. Now we’re building the next big thing: Taproot+, an online marketplace for pro bono service. The right developer will help us make it even bigger.

This position requires creativity, curiosity, and user-centered thinking. Our tech team operates in an agile environment, delivering products for multiple internal and external stakeholders across Taproot’s many programs and initiatives. The product is built in Ruby on Rails, but we have other products built in different technologies.

The ideal candidate will have full-stack web application experience and can handle the entire development cycle, from requirements analysis to design, coding, and unit testing. We are looking for a junior-to-mid-level Ruby/Rails developer OR someone with other coding experience who is a proven fast learner and wants to move into the Ruby/Rails world. Either way, you must love making big things happen in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial, mission-driven environment. The right junior developer will find this a great growth opportunity.  

You have:

►    Strong engineering foundations
►    Entrepreneurial, pragmatic mindset
►    Customer focus
►    High degree of personal motivation and attention to detail
►    Interest in the nonprofit sector
►    A successful track record
►    1-3 years of experience with Ruby/Rails or other technologies
►    Experience deploying and supporting a full stack web application, from server provisioning to light database maintenance
►    Familiarity with Agile or Lean software development
►    Track record of using source control, automated testing, and deployment to facilitate a scalable development team environment

We have:

►    A high-powered team dedicated to building ground-breaking products for the social sector
►    A name-brand nonprofit operating at the intersection of social change and big business
►    Great partners, including the innovation company helping us to build the marketplace

This role reports to the VP of Product and National Programs.

About Taproot                                                                                                                                     
Taproot is a nonprofit organization that makes business talent available to organizations working to improve society. Most organizations tackling social problems don’t have access to the marketing, design, technology, management or strategic planning resources they need to succeed. Without this talent, few are able to have their intended impact on critical issues like the environment, health and education. We engage the nation’s millions of business professionals in pro bono services. By taking lessons learned from our award-winning Service Grant Program and applying them to our innovative new program areas, we work to stimulate the supply of pro bono resources through our corporate Advisory Services practice, as well as demand for these services by giving nonprofits the tools and training that sets them up for successful pro bono engagements.

This is a full-time exempt position. Compensation and benefits are competitive, and commensurate with experience and ability. Applications accepted on rolling basis; position to start as soon as possible.

THE TAPROOT FOUNDATION IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. The Taproot Foundation strives to reflect the diverse community it serves. Applicants who contribute to this diversity are strongly encouraged to apply. Qualified applicants with criminal histories will be considered for the position in a manner consistent with the Fair Chance Ordinance.

To apply: Interested? Please submit resume, thoughtful cover letter, and relevant writing sample online at http://www.taprootfoundation.org/about-probono/job-description?gnk=job&gni=8a8725d04815aa150148197282f00e18.

item.title: Bombich Software: Senior Mac OS X Software Developer
item.description:
Location: Western Massachusetts
URL: http://bombich.com

We write Carbon Copy Cloner for OS X and are looking for an experienced OS X developer with deep operational knowledge of the Mac OS to join our team.

We were founded more than 10 years and have grown 100% by word of mouth. Our customers span more than 170 different countries, and our employees live and work across the United States, including Massachusetts, New York, Texas and Missouri. This is a remote position and we are interested in candidates that can work at least part of their day between 9am and 5pm EST and can legally work in the United States. We use Slack, Evernote, Basecamp, Google Docs, and Zendesk to collaborate.

What you need for this position:
  • At least 5 years of commercial software engineering experience, and at least 2 years in recent OS X commercial software application development for a well-known and broadly used application
  • Expert-level Objective-C and C skills
  • Expert-level knowledge and experience with OS X programming: Cocoa, Appkit, Grand Central Dispatch, Core Services (especially network and file system), ServiceManagement, XPC
  • Deep understanding of operating system fundamentals (startup process, launchd, local and network file systems -- how OS X "works")
  • Experience with version control, such as Subversion or Git
  • Expert-level experience with the last three releases of OS X, from both a development and operational perspective
  • Experience with scripting languages (bash and AppleScript preferred)
  • B.S. in Computer Science or equivalent software development and build engineering experience
  • Communicate well on a remote team (previous remote employment a plus)
  • Fluent in English

Bonuses:
  • Fluent in Spanish, German, French, Dutch, Japanese or Italian
  • Expert-level experience with Carbon Copy Cloner

What you'll be doing:
  • Perform day-to-day bugfixes and improvements
  • Be a part of the entire app life cycle - concept, design, build, deploy, test, release and support
  • Assist with new feature development
 
What's in it for you:
  • $110K+ salary
  • Medical insurance stipend
  • Disability and Life Insurance
  • 401k with matching company contribution
  • The most up-to-date technology, including company-issued Macs, the latest software and other tools needed to excel at your job
  • A really comfy chair and desk
  • Company-paid conferences and extended learning
  • Yearly company gatherings
  • Generous PTO
  • Flexible, remote work environment
  • Small, tight-knit team
 
Outsourcing development companies and non-US work eligible applicants need not apply.

To apply: Apply at https://bombich.recruiterbox.com/jobs/fk0g6l

item.title: Help Scout: Java Software Engineer
item.description:
Location: Boston, MA
URL: http://www.helpscout.net

The ideal engineer for this position loves managing APIs and other web services at scale. You relish the opportunity to take on a challenging problem, choose the right tool for the job and build an elegant, scalable solution.

Our engineering team is small (7), remote and responsible for supporting the code they write (talking to customers). There is no dedicated QA team. Due to our size, Help Scout is not the right fit for entry-level or junior engineers at this time.

Some of the tools we use
  • Java 7 and 8
  • Play framework
  • MySQL, MongoDB. Solr
  • RabbitMQ
  • Git
  • PHP
  • Javascript (Backbone & Marionette)

About the Role
  • You'll build/maintain the Help Scout APIs alongside one other engineer on the team. Your world includes everything from documentation to new endpoints and performance optimization. All new product features are built on the APIs and we'd like them to be a pleasure for developers to use as well.
  • The team consists of 7 senior-level engineers. Aside from a couple of weekly check-ins or project updates, you'll be able to work interruption-free. 90% of our communication happens over chat.
  • You'll be working with product people. The founders are technical and committed to creating a magical experience for customers. You'll deploy high quality work that moves the needle for businesses around the world.

About You
  • You became an engineer because you like writing software that helps people.
  • You have a history of working on products at scale and can bring a high level of expertise to the business.
  • Your code is not only a pleasure for customers to use, but for other engineers to read and understand easily.
  • You can speak and write in terms that non-geeks can understand clearly, whether it be in a conference call, blog post or support email.

Benefits
  • Work anywhere - work from our office in Boston or anywhere else, provided you have 4 hours of overlap with the team
  • Health & dental - we cover you and your family's health/dental insurance 100%
  • Flexible vacation - take time off when you need it, we trust you
  • Great tools - each employee needs a Mac laptop and 27' display, so we'll get you what you need
  • Complete transparency - everyone has full access to business metrics and financial information about the company

To apply: Start here- http://help-scout.workable.com/jobs/24579

item.title: 112 TECH: Team Webmaster
item.description:
Location: Can Work from Home
URL: www.112tech.com

We are looking for a motivated webmaster who enjoys the benefits of working from home. We are an experienced, driven and tightly-knit company with a team spread across many countries.
This position is for a webmaster who will be a key part of the team responsible for working to build, expand and improve the company's network of websites.

Job duties for this position include:
  • Editing current websites utilizing html, php, css
  • Creating new websites by working with design, writing and markup teams to combine elements
  • Updating content in html as well as custom cms
  • Recognizing opportunities for improvement of current websites including SEO, code improvements, content improvements and other general updates
  • Working closely with designers, coders and writers to update websites and help organize the creation of new websites
  • Brainstorming for new, unique ideas to improve our sites or expand our network

The person in this position should be self-motivated, well-organized, a team player, and detail-oriented. Must be willing to give and accept positive criticism and be willing to try new ideas, learn new skills and experiment with different ways of accomplishing tasks. The ability to work independently is also very important as the person in this position will be working from their home office. They must be able to take on a task and see it through, often without immediate input from other team members. With this in mind, time management is also an important skill. There will often be multiple tasks ongoing at the same time and it will be up to each team member to complete their jobs on time as to keep the work flowing.

Skills required include:
  • General html, css, php, wordpress knowledge
  • Some understanding of CMS/databases
  • Experience using FTP
  • Some knowledge of basic website design
  • Image editing

We would like to know about your previous working experience and more particularly any office based work that you may have had, if you have had any, please detail.
Please also only apply if you are based in US or European timezones.

WE ARE LOOKING FOR A COMMITTED TEAM MEMBER, WITHOUT ANY OTHER WORK COMMITMENTS OR RESTRICTIONS THAT MAY PREVENT THEM FROM WORKING FULL TIME I.E (RUN A SEPARATE COMPANY, FREELANCE FOR OTHER BUSINESSES ETC).

Thank you for taking your time to read this post, we look forward to hearing from you!

To apply: Please fill in your details and send your CV in to us via this link - https://112tech.theresumator.com/apply/rjD566/Team-Webmaster.html
